title.value: Family risk communication preferences in pediatric surgery: A scoping review
title.justification: The title 'Family risk communication preferences in pediatric surgery: A scoping review' is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Family risk communication preferences in pediatric surgery: A scoping review

extractions.description: This paper is a scoping review that explores the preferences of families for risk communication methods in pediatric surgery. It identifies various communication modalities favored by families to ensure effective communication and shared decision-making in pediatric surgical care.

type.justification: The paper uses empirical methods, including a scoping review following PRISMA guidelines, to gather and analyze data on family communication preferences.
type.quote: The protocol for the study was designed in concordance with the Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses for Scoping Reviews guidelines (PRISMA-ScR; refer to Supplementary Material A for checklist) and registered with PROSPERO.

name.justification: The study focuses on communication methods between healthcare providers and families in pediatric surgery, which places it in the field of healthcare communication.
name.quote: The importance of effective communication in pediatric surgical practice cannot be overstated.

name.justification: The study specifically addresses communication in the context of pediatric surgery, aiming to improve decision-making processes within this medical field.
name.quote: This scoping review explored the family-preferred methods for risk communication in pediatric surgery.
